intro: Geigeria pectidea, commonly known as the white-flowered geigeria, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its delicate, daisy-like flowers with white petals and yellow centers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has narrow, linear leaves and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Geigeria pectidea is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
